Package ohos.agp.window.dialog

Class PopupDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.window.dialog.BaseDialog
      • ohos.agp.window.dialog.PopupDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDialog

    public class PopupDialog
extends BaseDialog
    Creates popup dialogs that are used with specific components.
    Since:
    1

                   int width,

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the context to use.
        contentComponent - Indicates the component associated with the pop-up dialog box.
        width - Indicates the width of the pop-up dialog box.
        height - Indicates the height of the pop-up dialog box.

    • Method Detail

      • setHasArrow

        public PopupDialog setHasArrow​(boolean status)
        Sets whether to display an arrow in this PopupDialog object.
        Parameters:
        status - Specifies whether an arrow is displayed in this pop-up dialog box. The value true indicates that an arrow is displayed, and {code false} indicates not.
        Returns:
        Returns the PopupDialog object.
        Since:
        4

      • setArrowSize

        public void setArrowSize​(int width,
                         int height)
        Sets the arrow size for this PopupDialog object.

        This method takes effect only when the status parameter of setHasArrow(boolean) is set to true.

        Parameters:
        width - Indicates the arrow width to set.
        height - Indicates the arrow height to set.
        Since:
        4

        protected void onShow​()
        Description copied from class: BaseDialog

        This method takes priority over the onShowing() method.

      • setMode

        public PopupDialog setMode​(int mode)
        Sets the alignment mode.

        Options include upper-left alignment, lower-left alignment, upper-right alignment, and lower-right alignment.

        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates the alignment mode to use.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for further use. For example, obj.setText(text).show().

      • setText

        public PopupDialog setText​(String text)
        Sets the text content in the dialog.

        This cannot be empty except in user-defined scenarios. setHasArrow(boolean)

        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the text content in the dialog.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for further use. For example, obj.setText(text).show().

      • setCustomComponent

        public PopupDialog setCustomComponent​(Component customComponent)
        Sets the customized content.

        The dialog will display the customized content and layout.

        Parameters:
        customComponent - Indicates the customized component encapsulated in a ComponentContainer object.
        Returns:
        Returns the Dialog object for further use. For example, obj.setText(text).show().

      • showOnCertainPosition

        public void showOnCertainPosition​(int alignment,
                                  int x,
                                  int y)
        Forcibly displays a dialog in a certain position.

        This display position is irrelevant to the component.

        Parameters:
        alignment - Indicates the alignment style, such as left alignment, right alignment, and vertical centered.
        x - Indicates the X position of the dialog.
        y - Indicates the Y position of the dialog.
        Since:
        4
